qas.question: What kind of woods always have very clearly marked seasonal growth?
What size pores form early in ring-porous woods' growing season?
When does the denser tissue the new pores abut come from?

context: In <a0_0>ring-porous<a0_0/> woods each season's growth is always well defined, because the <a1_0>large<a1_0/> pores formed early in the season abut on the denser tissue of <a2_0>the year before<a2_0/>.
